page.title: 02ECOLOGY PLANTS AND WILDLIFE
page.content: Wildlife in the area includes moles, badgers,squirrels,worms,hedgehogs, voles,rabbits and foxes.Birds such as rooks,ravens,wagtails,blackbirds, thrushes,sparrows,finches,pheasants and woodcocks can be found.The insect life includes beetles,spiders,flies, moths, ladybirds,gnats,grasshoppers, earwigs, butterflies,millipedes, woodlice, ants and aphids.On the ponds and streams of Bredgar and Rodmersham coot and mallard live wild.A large amount of natural vegetation still exists in this area, especially round the disused chalkpits in Highsted.Trees include oak,ash, beech,hawthorn and cypress.There is a Chestnut plantation in Dungate. Wild grasses are interspersed with wild flowers such as buttercups,poppies, roses,meadow cranebell,cinquefoil, primroses and daisies.The roads in out lying parts have hedgerows of hawthorn.
